title: Approx., eval., def. integral; L'Hosp.: Tabular

content.question: (a) Use a midpoint Riemann sum with three subintervals of equal length indicated by the data in the table to approximate the value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOzaiaacI cacaaI2aGaaiykaaaa@38FA@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

frqParts.text: (a) Use a midpoint Riemann sum with three subintervals of equal length indicated by the data in the table to approximate the value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOzaiaacI cacaaI2aGaaiykaaaa@38FA@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(b) Determine whether the actual value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOzaiaacI cacaaI2aGaaiykaaaa@38FA@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> could be 70. Explain your reasoning.

topic.text: 4.7: Using L'Hospital's Rule for Determining Limits of Indeterminate Forms

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
